alert.note: Alert for Caroline; King William; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 3:30PM EST until November 11 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST FOR NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...EAST CENTRAL CAROLINE AND NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM COUNTIES... At 330 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Beulahville, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Newtown around 340 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Duane Fork, Gether and Owenton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; King William; King and Queen
